meanings.definition: To become fully developed in body or mind.
meanings.sent1: As a caterpillar grows, it eventually matures into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: The fruit on the tree matures and becomes ripe for picking.
meanings.sent3: The young puppy matures into a wise old dog, wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: Like a fine wine, his talent matures with age, becoming more refined over time.
meanings.sent5: Her understanding of the subject matures as she studies and learns more about it.

meanings.definition: To reach the most advanced stage in a process.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, the project finally matures into a successful business.
meanings.sent2: The friendship between the two neighbors matures into a deep bond of trust.
meanings.sent3: The seedling matures into a strong tree, providing shade and shelter.
meanings.sent4: The idea matures into a revolutionary invention that changes the world.
meanings.sent5: His skills in playing the piano matures to a level where he can perform in front of a large audience.

meanings.definition: To reach the age of full legal responsibility.
meanings.sent1: When she turns 18, she legally matures and can make her own decisions.
meanings.sent2: In some countries, a person matures at the age of 21 and gains full rights as an adult.
meanings.sent3: The young adult eagerly awaits the day he matures and can sign legal documents.
meanings.sent4: As he matures into a legal adult, he takes on the responsibilities that come with it.
meanings.sent5: The teenager looks forward to the day he matures and can vote in elections.
